definition: a cutting tool that consists of a heavy edged head fixed to a handle with the edge parallel to the handle and that is used especially for felling trees and chopping and splitting wood
a hammer with a sharp edge for dressing (see dress entry 1 sense 6e) or spalling stone
removal from office or release from employment : dismissal
examples: Employees with poor evaluations got the ax.
Trump quickly gave him the ax [=fired him] for his incompetence.

definition: abrupt elimination or severe reduction of something
examples: Unlimited expense accounts, signing bonuses, and office plants—all are getting the ax [=being cut or eliminated] thanks to corporate cost-cutting measures.
No party was brave enough to offend its supporters by taking an axe to [=severely reducing] expenditure.

definition: any of several musical instruments (such as a guitar or a saxophone)
an ulterior often selfish underlying purpose
examples: claims that he has no ax to grind in criticizing the proposed law

definition: to shape, dress (see dress entry 1 sense 6e), or trim with an ax
to chop, split, or sever with an ax
to remove abruptly (as from employment or from a budget)
examples: The TV program was axed from the new schedule.

definition: Emanuel 1949–     American (Ukrainian-born of Polish parents) pianist
